forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. North northwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a subtle promise of rain, echoing the forecast that predicts drizzles after midnight. A blanket of clouds looms over the city, creating a somewhat subdued atmosphere, with a low temperature that hovers around a crisp 50 degrees. The gentle north-northwest breeze stirs occasionally, adding a whisper of chill that suggests bundling up in layers would be wise. Tonight, the streets may glisten with any forthcoming moisture, and the possibility of a light mist will only enhance the city’s ethereal charm.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the day promises to break with fleeting moments of sunshine, yet the clouds will persist, framing the high temperature around 57 degrees before dipping slightly in the afternoon. Gusts brushing in from the northwest will lend an air of briskness, reminding us that this coastal city holds onto its maritime character tightly even as spring begins to tease us with warmer days. Given the unpredictable nature of the elements, a well-prepared individual might find pleasure in a leisurely stroll through the Mission District, perhaps reveling in artisan coffee shops that boast their unique brews, or delving into the vibrant culture of local street art. All the while, it would be prudent to keep an umbrella handy just in case the forecast decides to play true to form.
